title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Creativity is as important as data literacy in the AI era, says IBM exec
items.description: Human ingenuity and a willingness to experiment are now vital for advancing in the AI economy.

items.title: Grade Inflation Is Deflating the Workforce
items.description: If colleges keep handing out meaningless grades, more testing could provide a better measure of what students have learned.

items.title: Tariff threats and Gen Z sobriety have put winemakers in Bordeaux on red alert
items.description: French wine production has plummeted to 60-year lows, as trade wars and changing drinking habits hurt sales.

items.title: Mamdani vows NYPD will 'never' go back to Adams-era cooperation with ICE enforcement
items.description: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani doubled down on a campaign pledge Wednesday, declaring the NYPD will be “delivering public safety, not assisting ICE."

items.title: Johor is building a 7300-acre innovation hub on the Singapore border, offering ‘land and scale’ for its neighbor’s ‘capital and speed’
items.description: Johor doesn't have the building blocks for innovation, Datuk Syed Mohamed Syed Ibrahim, JCorp's CEO, explained. “But in Singapore, there are.”

items.title: More Big Tech company debt ‘would increase the macro risks associated with the AI build-out,’ Goldman Sachs warns
items.description: Amazon, Google, Meta, Microsoft, and Oracle have taken on $121 billion in new debt, year-to-date—quadruple the amount from the prior five years.
